Policy: 1: Lower Individual Income Tax Rates Across the Board (Lower All Rates by 10%)
2: Lower the Top Marginal Income Tax Rate (25% Top Rate)
3: Consolidate Current Brackets into Three: 10 percent, 25 percent, and 35 percent
4: Reduce Employer- and Employee-Side Payroll Tax by 1 Percentage Point Split (1 Percentage Point Split)
5: Lower the Top Rate on Capital Gains and Dividends to 15 Percent
6: Index Capital Gains Realizations to Inflation
7: Make 100 Percent Bonus Depreciation Permanent
8: Implement Neutral Cost Recovery for Structures
9: Cancel the Amortization of Research and Development Expenses
10: Make Section 199A Deduction Permanent
11: Lower the Corporate Tax Rate (Lower to 15%)
12: Lower the Estate Tax Rate to 30 Percent
51: Double EITC for Workers without Qualifying Children to $1,075
52: Reform the EITC for Married and Unmarried Workers, with and without Children
S1: Free, universal pre-kindergarten for all three- and four-year olds
S2: Tuition-free two-year community college
S3: Increase Pell Grants for low-income students
S4: Increase funding for community colleges
S5: Two-years of subsidized tuition for students from families earning less than $125,000 enrolled in a four-year HBCU, TCU, or MSI
S6: Train, equip, and diversify American teachers
S7: Increase institutional aid grants to HBCUs, TCUs, and MSIs
S8: Make child care more affordable, invest in high-quality care, and fund training for child care providers
S9: Create a national comprehensive paid family and medical leave program
S10: Expand summer Electronic Benefits Transfer to all eligible children nationwide
S11: Expand free meals for children in the highest poverty districts
S12: Facilitate re-entry for formerly incarcerated individuals through Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP) eligibility
S17: Cancel student loan debt relief (Biden executive action)
15: Repeal the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (TCJA) Individual Tax Changes
19: Eliminate the Child Tax Credit
20: Reduce the Child Tax Credit to $500
21: Eliminate the Earned Income Tax Credit
25: Eliminate the Charitable Deduction
38: Eliminate the Section 199A Deduction
46: Lower the Estate and Gift Tax Exemption Amount to $2 Million
48: Increase the Gas Tax by 35 Cents Per Gallon and Inflation Adjust Going Forward
49: Reinstate the Cadillac Tax
59: Tax Individual Incomes at a Flat 30% Rate (20% Flat Tax)
61: Permanently Eliminate the Pease Limitation on Itemized Deductions
65: Enact Full Expensing for All Capital Investment
66: Maintain Limitation on Interest Deductibility at 30 Percent of EBITDA
67: Eliminate Various Business Tax Expenditures
68: Replace the Corporate Income Tax with a 5 Percent Value-Added Tax (VAT)
69: Eliminate Estate and Gift Taxes
